block.p: Dr. Allison Gamboa Hays and Dr. Farooq Hameed Sheikh are to be married today at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx. Kim Kirkley, an interfaith minister, is to officiate.

The bride and bridegroom are cardiology fellows, she at New York University Medical Center in New York and he at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore. They met during their residencies in internal medicine at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Columbia University Medical Center.

Dr. Allison Gamboa Hays and Dr. Farooq Hameed Sheikh are to be married today at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx. Kim Kirkley, an interfaith minister, is to officiate.

The bride and bridegroom are cardiology fellows, she at New York University Medical Center in New York and he at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore. They met during their residencies in internal medicine at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Columbia University Medical Center.
The bride, 31, graduated with two bachelor's degrees, in English and biology, from Stanford and received her medical degree from Columbia.

She is the daughter of Dr. Eugenia Gamboa and Dr. Arthur Hays of Demarest, N.J. Her parents work at NewYork-Presbyterian/Columbia hospital; her father, a neuropathologist, is the director of the neuromuscular pathology laboratory, and her mother is a clinical neurologist in the Neurological Institute of New York.
The bridegroom, 33, graduated from Haverford and received a medical degree from New York Medical College in Valhalla.

He is a son of Dr. Fatima Sheikh and Dr. Shahid Sheikh of Briarcliff Manor, N.Y. His mother, who is retired, worked in New Rochelle, N.Y., as a pediatrician in a clinic of the Westchester County Health Department. His father, a cardiologist in Yonkers, is the chief of cardiology at St. John's Riverside Hospital there.
